trans:
2. BUT there were people not dressed according to the dress code, which, of course, we did not like at all üò°
You come in wearing sexy, semi-transparent lingerie (I was wearing white), on tiptoes, and there's a man with a woman wearing regular clothes üò≥ I've never seen anything like this before, to be honest... Whether in Poland or Germany, the dress code was always checked, and they asked to show what you were wearing under your outer clothes. But not here, and this immediately made us feel uncomfortable üôà
Even those who were dressed according to the dress code didn't put in much effort. I've seen much cooler and more striking outfits in Warsaw and Berlin. But maybe we just weren't lucky))
3. However, there was a separate room with a guard at the entrance who made sure that only those wearing underwear could enter. So my boyfriend was only allowed in after he took off his pants (although they weren't jeans or trousers).
4. And they DID NOT cover our cameras! Of course, there was a sign saying that filming was prohibited, but it was still unusual. Especially since the party's website stated that phones are taken away at the entrance (like they do at KitKat, for example), but this did not happen!
